info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 19 at 11:04PM EDT until April 22 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette MI
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Marquette has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Michigan...
Sturgeon River near Alston affecting Baraga and Houghton Counties.
* WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by snowmelt are occurring.
* WHERE...Sturgeon River near Alston.
* WHEN...From this evening to Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Homes and structures along the low lying areas and numerous roads become impacted by flood water. In Houghton County...Sturgeon River Road...Aho Road...and Rajala Road are impacted. In Baraga County...Sturgeon Road...Halonen Road and Usitalo Road are impacted. Along Froberg Road...Tahtinen Road... Irwin Road...Oliver Road...and Shirley Road are impacted.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 7.2 feet Saturday, April 26. - Action stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette.
The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 1215 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TUESDAY MORNING
